A **torch** is a new [weapon-tool](/wiki/Weapon-tool "Weapon-tool") in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"). A lit torch becomes your [wielded](/wiki/Wield "Wield") weapon (using the [club](/wiki/Club "Club") skill) and does [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire") damage to monsters. A new torch can stay lit for 600 to 899 turns[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) before it burns out.

When a lit torch hits a monster without [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), it deals 1 extra damage, plus an additional 1d3 damage if the monster resists cold.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) It also has a chance of destroying [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion"), [scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll") or [spellbooks](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook") in the monster's inventory.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Usage](#Usage)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 dNethack](#dNethack)
- [5 History](#History)
- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

In SLASH'EM, torches may be found randomly on the ground and in shops. Additionally, the following roles may start with a stack of two torches, with the given chances:

- [Archeologists](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist"): 3⁄32[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)
- [Barbarians](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian"): 1⁄6[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)
- [Priests](/wiki/Priest "Priest"): 9⁄200[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)
- [Valkyries](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie"): 1⁄12[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

## Usage

To light a torch, [apply](/wiki/Apply "Apply") it with [a](/wiki/A "A"). This wields the torch! A cursed torch will weld itself to your hand. You can't light a torch if you can't wield it (for example, when wielding a cursed weapon, or polymorphed into something without [hands](/wiki/Hand "Hand")).

To extinguish a wielded lit torch, either [apply](/wiki/Apply "Apply") it again, or wield something else. You can't keep a lit torch in your [pack](/wiki/Pack "Pack"); you will automatically extinguish the torch. However, you can [drop](/wiki/Drop "Drop") or [throw](/wiki/Throw "Throw") a lit torch, and it will stay lit. By dropping a lit torch, you can enjoy its light while you wield a better weapon. If you [pick up](/wiki/Pick_up "Pick up") a lit torch, you automatically extinguish it.

A lit torch shines for radius 3, same as a [brass lantern](/wiki/Brass_lantern "Brass lantern"), [oil lamp](/wiki/Oil_lamp "Oil lamp") or [magic candle](/wiki/Magic_candle "Magic candle"). However, those light sources are more convenient because you can carry them without wielding them.

## Strategy

In general, torches will see little use. As a light source, they are inconvenient because they cannot be used without being wielded, and as a weapon they do very poor damage. Characters who start with torches or find them early on might use them to speed up exploration of the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines"), but even a mundane [oil lamp](/wiki/Oil_lamp "Oil lamp") or [brass lantern](/wiki/Brass_lantern "Brass lantern") is superior.

## dNethack

In [dNethack](/wiki/DNethack "DNethack"), torches behave somewhat differently from SLASH'EM.

- Torches do not have to be wielded to be lit.
- Torches deal increased fire damage on hit, 1d6+enchantment, multiplied by 1.5 if the defender resists cold.
- A lit torch shines for radius 4, and burns down to radius 3 and 2 as it runs out of time. When it completely burns out, there's a small chance it will leave behind a burnt [club](/wiki/Club "Club").

## History

| ------------------------------------------------------------------------ | --------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

The torch first appeared in a [patch](/wiki/Patch "Patch") for NetHack 3.4.0, which was incorporated into SLASH'EM 0.0.7E0.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)
